query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 «S’io ti fiammeggio nel caldo d’amore 2 di là dal modo che ’n terra si vede, 3 sì che del viso tuo vinco il valore,
4 non ti maravigliar, ché ciò procede 5 da perfetto veder, che, come apprende, 6 così nel bene appreso move il piede.
query.result:
**English:**
1 “If I inflame you with the warmth of love 2 beyond the way that is seen on earth, 3 so that I overcome the power of your sight,
4 do not be amazed, for this proceeds 5 from perfect seeing, which, as it apprehends, 6 so moves the foot in the good that is apprehended.
**Cornish:**
1 “Mar karys vy dhe flammya gans tommos karantek 2 a-ves dhe’n fordh a wellir war an nor, 3 pubma ow kovlaf nerth aga golwg,
4 na’th omrewgh, rag hemma a dheu drefen 5 a welas perthek, hag, kepar ha dysk, 6 ow teves an tros ynno an da yn mes.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
13 Tu vuo’ saper se con altro servigio, 14 per manco voto, si può render tanto 15 che l’anima sicuri di letigio».
query.result:
**English:**
13 You want to know if with another service, 14 for a lesser vow, one can render so much 15 that the soul is assured of no dispute.
**Cornish:**
13 Whans yw eus karas ha gans servys erel, 14 rag mann a veu mank, gallos den gul re 15 pubma ow sygur aga eneval dhe’n stryf.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 Sì cominciò Beatrice questo canto; 17 e sì com’ uom che suo parlar non spezza, 18 continüò così ’l processo santo:
19 «Lo maggior don che Dio per sua larghezza 20 fesse creando, e a la sua bontate 21 più conformato, e quel ch’e’ più apprezza,
22 fu de la volontà la libertate; 23 di che le creature intelligenti, 24 e tutte e sole, fuoro e son dotate.
query.result:
**English:**
16 Thus Beatrice began this song; 17 and like one who does not break off his speech, 18 she continued the holy discourse thus:
19 “The greatest gift that God in his generosity 20 made in creating, and to his goodness 21 most conformed, and that which he most values,
22 was the freedom of the will; 23 with which intelligent creatures, 24 and they alone, were and are endowed.
**Cornish:**
16 Kepar hyn Beatrice a dhallathas an kan, 17 ha kepar den na wraga y’n lavar, 18 ow kovyas an lavar sans:
19 “An ro dhynnertha a roos Duw yn y voynder 20 ow kul yn kreygya, ha dhe’y vonder 21 moyha kemmyskys, ha’n traow moyha a gar,
22 o an frankis a’n volonteth; 23 hag an kreaduriow deall, 24 pub ha pub onan, a veu ha yw dotys.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 Dunque che render puossi per ristoro? 32 Se credi bene usar quel c’hai offerto, 33 di maltolletto vuo’ far buon lavoro.
query.result:
**English:**
31 Therefore, what can be given in compensation? 32 If you believe you are using well what you have offered, 33 you want to make good work out of bad material.
**Cornish:**
31 Dell pyth yw gallos rag kompensasyon? 32 Gen gre'thys owth owth ow leverel yn ta, 33 owth ow leverel drok owth ow leverel da.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 Tu se’ omai del maggior punto certo; 35 ma perché Santa Chiesa in ciò dispensa, 36 che par contra lo ver ch’i’ t’ho scoverto,
37 convienti ancor sedere un poco a mensa, 38 però che ’l cibo rigido c’hai preso, 39 richiede ancora aiuto a tua dispensa.
query.result:
**English:**
34 You are now certain of the most important point; 35 but because Holy Church dispenses in this, 36 which seems contrary to the truth that I have revealed to you,
37 you must still sit down at the table for a while, 38 because the hard food that you have taken 39 still requires help from your pantry.
**Cornish:**
34 Mes owth ow leverel syur a'n poynt moyha; 35 mes rag Eglos Sans yn ta a wra dyspens, 36 henna a wra'gas yn erbyn an gwir owth ow leverel owth ow diskudhys dhe'th ow,
37 owth ow leverel a wra'gas dhe'sel dhe'n fordh rag termyn, 38 rag an boes kalet owth ow leverel owth ow kemeres, 39 a wra'gas dhe'sel dhe'n fordh skoedh dhe'th ow dispensa.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
40 Apri la mente a quel ch’io ti paleso 41 e fermalvi entro; ché non fa scïenza, 42 sanza lo ritenere, avere inteso.
query.result:
**English:**
40 Open your mind to what I reveal to you 41 and fix it within; for without retaining it, 42 having understood is not knowledge.
**Cornish:**
40 Digor dhe'th spyr dhe'n hyn owth ow leverel owth ow diskudhys dhe'th ow, 41 ha'gas owth ow dhe'sel dhe'nna; rag nyns yw skiens, 42 heb owth ow dhe'sel dhe'nna, dhe'n fordh komprehendya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
43 Due cose si convegnono a l’essenza 44 di questo sacrificio: l’una è quella 45 di che si fa; l’altr’ è la convenenza.
query.result:
**English:**
43 Two things are necessary for the essence 44 of this sacrifice: one is that 45 of which it is made; the other is the agreement.
**Cornish:**
43 Dew dra a wra gesys rag essens 44 a'n sakrifis ma: an kynsa yw henna 45 a wra gwres; an nessa yw an kesunyans.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 Quest’ ultima già mai non si cancella 47 se non servata; e intorno di lei 48 sì preciso di sopra si favella:
49 però necessitato fu a li Ebrei 50 pur l’offerere, ancor ch’alcuna offerta 51 sì permutasse, come saver dei.
query.result:
**English:**
46 This latter is never cancelled 47 unless it is kept; and concerning it 48 we have spoken so precisely above:
49 therefore the Hebrews were compelled 50 to offer it, even though some offering 51 was changed, as you will know.
**Cornish:**
46 An nessa nyns yw kensys byth 47 marnas servyes; ha'gas owth ow leverel 48 kewsys yn kler yn fenowgh a-ugh:
49 rag henna an Ebreon oedh gesys 50 dhe'n fordh owth ow leverel, bythow tek oedh nebes 51 owth ow leverel owth ow permutya, dell owth ow leverel a wra gowsow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
52 L’altra, che per materia t’è aperta, 53 puote ben esser tal, che non si falla 54 se con altra materia si converta.
query.result:
**English:**
52 The other, which is open to you as regards the material, 53 can indeed be such that one does not err 54 if it is converted with another material.
**Cornish:**
52 An nessa, henna a wra aghes dhe'th ow rag materyal, 53 a allsa bos bydel dell, na wra'gas owth ow leverel 54 gen ev a wra konvertyes gans materyal aral.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
61 Però qualunque cosa tanto pesa 62 per suo valor che tragga ogne bilancia, 63 sodisfar non si può con altra spesa.
query.result:
**English:**
61 Therefore, whatever thing weighs so much 62 by its value that it tips every scale, 63 cannot be compensated for with any other expense.
**Cornish:**
61 Rag henna, pub tra a wra'gas kemmys poos 62 rag y werth dhe'sel dhe'n fordh owth ow leverel owth ow droylya pub balans, 63 nyns yw gallos dhe'sel dhe'n fordh dhe'sel dhe'n fordh kompensya gans neb aral kost.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
64 Non prendan li mortali il voto a ciancia; 65 siate fedeli, e a ciò far non bieci, 66 come Ieptè a la sua prima mancia;
67 cui più si convenia dicer ‘Mal feci’, 68 che, servando, far peggio; e così stolto 69 ritrovar puoi il gran duca de’ Greci,
70 onde pianse Efigènia il suo bel volto, 71 e fé pianger di sé i folli e i savi 72 ch’udir parlar di così fatto cólto.
query.result:
**English:**
64 Mortals should not make vows lightly; 65 be faithful, and do not be wicked in doing so, 66 like Jephthah with his first offering;
67 who should have said, ‘I did wrong’, 68 rather than keep his vow and do worse; and just as foolish 69 you can find the great leader of the Greeks,
70 because of whom Iphigenia wept her beautiful face, 71 and made both the wise and the foolish weep for her 72 when they heard tell of such a cruel sacrifice.
**Cornish:**
64 Na wra vydh anvervel an lowennow yn folneth; 65 bydhus feal, ha na wra drogys yn gwul an keth, 66 dell yw Yeffte dhe’y gynsa offryans;
67 Neb a via moyha kov ‘Gwall yw gwulsa’, 68 ages servya, gwul moyha; ha felly fol 69 y hwra kavos an myghtern meur a’n Gresiens,
70 rag an keth a wilas Efigenia y hendre beel, 71 ha gul fol ha fur a wilas ragthi, 72 pan glewsons ankowtya avelsa cruel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
73 Siate, Cristiani, a muovervi più gravi: 74 non siate come penna ad ogne vento, 75 e non crediate ch’ogne acqua vi lavi.
query.result:
**English:**
73 Be more steadfast, Christians, in your actions: 74 do not be like a feather in every wind, 75 and do not believe that every water will wash you clean.
**Cornish:**
73 Bydhus, Kristyon, moyha pysk dhe’n gwriansow: 74 na wra ges dell pluven yn pub gwyns, 75 ha na grysouch pub dowr a wra’th golhi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
76 Avete il novo e ’l vecchio Testamento, 77 e ’l pastor de la Chiesa che vi guida; 78 questo vi basti a vostro salvamento.
query.result:
**English:**
76 You have the New and the Old Testament, 77 and the shepherd of the Church to guide you; 78 let this suffice for your salvation.
**Cornish:**
76 Yw genowgh an Testaments Nowydh ha Koth, 77 ha’n mester an Eglos rag’yw holya; 78 hemma a wra dos orth aga’n salvacyon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
79 Se mala cupidigia altro vi grida, 80 uomini siate, e non pecore matte, 81 sì che ’l Giudeo di voi tra voi non rida!
82 Non fate com’ agnel che lascia il latte 83 de la sua madre, e semplice e lascivo 84 seco medesmo a suo piacer combatte!».
query.result:
**English:**
79 If evil desire tells you otherwise, 80 be men, and not stupid sheep, 81 so that the Jew will not laugh at you among yourselves!
82 Do not act like a lamb that leaves the milk 83 of its mother, and simple and wanton 84 fights with itself at its own pleasure!”
**Cornish:**
79 Mar cupidigieth drog a leverowgh orth, 80 bydhus den, ha na wra deves fol, 81 marnas an Yudhew a wra na gorra orth!
82 Na wra gwul dell evel a wra gwell an leas 83 a’y vam, ha sempel ha fol 84 a wra’y omladh gans y bleser!”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
85 Così Beatrice a me com’ ïo scrivo; 86 poi si rivolse tutta disïante 87 a quella parte ove ’l mondo è più vivo.
query.result:
**English:**
85 Thus Beatrice spoke to me, as I write; 86 then she turned, full of longing, 87 to that part where the world is most alive.
**Cornish:**
85 Felly Beatrice a leveris dhym dell y skrifav; 86 wosa henna hi a droas oll lanwes 87 dhe’n rann ma’n beys an bys moyha byw.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
94 Quivi la donna mia vid’ io sì lieta, 95 come nel lume di quel ciel si mise, 96 che più lucente se ne fé ’l pianeta.
query.result:
**English:**
94 There I saw my lady so joyful, 95 as she entered the light of that heaven, 96 that the planet became more radiant.
**Cornish:**
94 Eno henna y’m gwelas va’n benen so lowen, 95 pan wrughi hi dhe’n goleudh a’n nef a-ugh, 96 neb moy moyha golow a wrug an planed.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
97 E se la stella si cambiò e rise, 98 qual mi fec’ io che pur da mia natura 99 trasmutabile son per tutte guise!
100 Come ’n peschiera ch’è tranquilla e pura 101 traggonsi i pesci a ciò che vien di fori 102 per modo che lo stimin lor pastura,
103 sì vid’ io ben più di mille splendori 104 trarsi ver’ noi, e in ciascun s’udia: 105 «Ecco chi crescerà li nostri amori».
query.result:
**English:**
97 And if the star changed and grew brighter, 98 what must I have been like, who by my very nature 99 am changeable in every way!
100 As in a tranquil and clear fishpond 101 the fish are drawn to what comes from outside, 102 thinking it is their food,
103 so I saw well over a thousand splendours 104 approaching us, and from each one I heard: 105 “Behold, one who will increase our love”.
**Cornish:**
97 Ha pan wrug an steren chanjya ha mos, 98 pyth vyth oen a wra, neb dre vyn natur 99 y’m chanjabyl yn pub fordh!
100 Dell peskiera a wra tawel ha kler 101 an pesk a wra’n kethwel dhe’n hansa a-ugh 102 rag an fordh ma’th ensons aga boos,
103 felly y’m gwelas moy ages mil a splannder 104 ow tos dhe’n keth, ha yn pub onen a glewsons: 105 “Selma, neb a wra kreski aga karantew”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
106 E sì come ciascuno a noi venìa, 107 vedeasi l’ombra piena di letizia 108 nel folgór chiaro che di lei uscia.
query.result:
**English:**
106 And as each one came towards us, 107 I could see the shade full of joy 108 in the bright radiance that issued from it.
**Cornish:**
106 Ha dell pub onen a dheuth dhe’n keth, 107 y’m gwelas an sketh lenwys a lowender 108 yn an folgor kler a dheuth dhyworthi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
115 «O bene nato a cui veder li troni 116 del trïunfo etternal concede grazia 117 prima che la milizia s’abbandoni,
118 del lume che per tutto il ciel si spazia 119 noi semo accesi; e però, se disii 120 di noi chiarirti, a tuo piacer ti sazia».
query.result:
**English:**
115 "O blessed one to whom grace grants 116 to see the thrones of eternal triumph 117 before the army disbands,
118 we are kindled by the light that spreads 119 throughout all of heaven; and therefore, if you desire 120 to be enlightened about us, satisfy yourself at your pleasure."
**Cornish:**
115 "O benen genys dhe dhynnerghas gras 116 dhe wul an tryumf sempiternel 117 kyns an milita a veu dhyskynnys,
118 an golon a splann a-dreus an nef 119 ny yw enkowgh; ha dre henna, pub vy 120 a vynnerghas klerheansow, dhe les."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
121 Così da un di quelli spirti pii 122 detto mi fu; e da Beatrice: «Dì, dì 123 sicuramente, e credi come a dii».
query.result:
**English:**
121 Thus one of those pious spirits 122 spoke to me; and Beatrice said: "Speak, speak 123 confidently, and believe as if to a god."
**Cornish:**
121 Vel dh'y spyrys pius 122 ow kewsys vy; ha Bees ha leverys: "Lever, lever 123 yn sur, ha kred an keth dhe dhew."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
130 Questo diss’ io diritto a la lumera 131 che pria m’avea parlato; ond’ ella fessi 132 lucente più assai di quel ch’ell’ era.
query.result:
**English:**
130 I said this directly to the light 131 that had spoken to me before; whereupon it became 132 much more radiant than it was.
**Cornish:**
130 Me a leveris henna yn sywya 131 dhe'n golon a leveris vy kyns; ha henna 132 a dhyskiis moy splendens ages pan o syns.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
133 Sì come il sol che si cela elli stessi 134 per troppa luce, come ’l caldo ha róse 135 le temperanze d’i vapori spessi,
136 per più letizia sì mi si nascose 137 dentro al suo raggio la figura santa; 138 e così chiusa chiusa mi rispuose
139 nel modo che ’l seguente canto canta.
query.result:
**English:**
133 Just as the sun conceals itself in its own light 134 because of too much brightness, as the heat has dispersed 135 the moderation of the thick vapors,
136 so, for greater joy, the holy figure 137 hid itself from me within its own radiance; 138 and thus, completely hidden, it answered me
139 in the manner that the following canto sings.
**Cornish:**
133 Dell yw an howl a wra'th kudhys yn y golon 134 rag an reydh moy, dell an tommder a dhyskiis 135 an temperans a'n vapuryow tewl,
136 rag moy lowena, henna a wra'th kudhys 137 yn y skynnans; ha vel dh'y figura sans 138 a leveris vy
139 yn an fordh a gana an kan a sew.
